prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector as [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This configuration will define the orientation and position of the 2D sketch for this part. Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Follow these instructions to create the loops and faces: 1. **Face 1:** * **Loop 1:** 1. **Line 1:** Start Point at [0.0, 0.0]; End Point at [0.3, 0.0] 2. **Line 2:** Start Point at [0.3, 0.0]; End Point at [0.3, 0.3] 3. **Line 3:** Start Point at [0.3, 0.3]; End Point at [0.0, 0.3] 4. **Line 4:** Start Point at [0.0, 0.3]; End Point at [0.0, 0.0] The given sketch has one face and one loop, with 4 lines. Step 3: Transform the Sketch into 3D Sketch Change the sketch to a 3D sketch. Now, apply the transformation with the given rotation (Euler angles) and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch into a 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D along the Z-axis. The extrusion values are as follows: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.75 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.3 After applying the given parameters, this operation will create a 3D model of a three-dimensional rectangular prism. The dimensions of this prism's sides are equal, and the height is half the length of the sides. Part 1 is complete. Continue on to the next parts in the CAD assembly JSON, following the same pattern: create a coordinate system, draw the 2D sketch, transform it into a 3D sketch, and then extrude the sketch into a 3D model. This method will ensure you generate the accurate CAD models needed for the assembly.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.3,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.0],"End Point":[0.3,0.3]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.3],"End Point":[0.0,0.3]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.3,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a rounded top and a flat bottom. The prism has a cylindrical hole in the center, which is slightly larger than the prism's width. The hole is cylindrical with a flat bottom and a slightly tapered top. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0714, 0.0] 2. Create 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw the first face of the prism: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0357, 0.1071], End Point [0.6071, 0.0] * Arc 1: Start Point [0.6071, 0.0], Mid Point [0.75, 0.1429], End Point [0.6071, 0.2857] * Line 2: Start Point [0.6071, 0.2857], End Point [0.0357, 0.1786] * Arc 2: Start Point [0.0357, 0.1786], Mid Point [0.0, 0.1429], End Point [0.0357, 0.1071] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D with a rotation of -90 degrees about the Z-axis and a translation of [0.0, 0.0714, 0.0]. 6. Extrude the sketch by 0.0357 units in the positive direction of its normal (towards the positive Z-axis). Part 2 Instructions Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The object has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a solid material. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0179, 0.0357, 0.125] 2. Create 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw the circular face of the cylindrical object: * Center [0.0179, 0.0179], Radius: 0.0179 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0357. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D with a rotation of -90 degrees about the Z-axis and a translation of [0.0179, 0.0357, 0.125]. 6. Extrude the scaled and transformed circle by 0.0357 units in the positive direction of its normal (towards the positive Z-axis). This adds material to the main body. The resulting CAD assembly consists of a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a rounded top and a flat bottom, and a cylindrical object with a tapered top and flat bottom. The prism has a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0714,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0357,0.1071],"End Point":[0.6071,0.0]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.6071,0.0],"Mid Point":[0.75,0.1429],"End Point":[0.6071,0.2857]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6071,0.2857],"End Point":[0.0357,0.1786]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.0357,0.1786],"Mid Point":[0.0,0.1429],"End Point":[0.0357,0.1071]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0357,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0179,0.0357,0.125]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.0179,0.0179],"Radius":0.0179}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0357,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.0357,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0, 0.375, 0.0]`. Now create the 2D sketch for the base of the part on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw two circles with the following properties: - Circle 1: Center at `[0.375, 0.375]`, radius 0.375 - Circle 2: Center at `[0.375, 0.375]`, radius 0.0937 Since there is only one face, there is only one face in the sketch. The sketch should look like two concentric circles. Next, scale the 2D sketch with the scaling parameter 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0, 0.375, 0.0]`. Now, extrude the 3D sketch with a depth of 0.375 units towards the normal and a depth of 0 opposite the normal, resulting in a length of 0.75 units. Part 2: Construct a tapered cylindrically-shaped object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.3259, 0.375, 0.3259]`. Create the 2D sketch for the base of the part on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw one circle with the following properties: - Circle 1: Center at `[0.0491, 0.0491]`, radius 0.0491 Since there is only one face, there is only one face in the sketch. The sketch should look like a single circle. Scale the 2D sketch with the scaling parameter 0.0982. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.3259, 0.375, 0.3259]`. Now, extrude the 3D sketch with a depth of 0.0938 units towards the normal and a depth of 0 opposite the normal, resulting in a length of 0.0983 units. Part 3: Construct a ring with a curved surface and a hollow center. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0, 0.375, 0.0]`. Draw a 2D sketch for the base of the part on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create two circles with the following properties: - Circle 1: Center at `[0.375, 0.375]`, radius 0.375 - Circle 2: Center at `[0.375, 0.375]`, radius 0.3516 Since there are no other faces, this results in one face in the sketch. Next, scale the 2D sketch with the scaling parameter 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0, 0.375, 0.0]`. Extrude the 3D sketch with depth 0.1875 towards the normal direction and a depth of 0 opposite the normal direction, resulting in a length of 0.75 units. The boolean operation for part 3 is to cut material from the existing part. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a central hole, resembling a roll of paper or a tube. Its height (including the central hole) is 0.75 units, and the height of the outer cylindrical surface is 0.5625 units. The length is 0.75 units, width is 0.375 units, and height is 0.75 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Part 1 Shape Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The hole is slightly larger than the width of the prism. The prism is positioned at a slight angle to the viewer. Part 1 Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system for Part 1 with the Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector of [0.0733, 0.0315, 0.0]. Part 1 Sketch 1. Draw a rectangle on face_1 of the coordinate system with the following lines: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.3464, 0.0] - line_2: [0.3464, 0.0] to [0.3464, 0.126] - line_3: [0.3464, 0.126] to [0.0, 0.126] - line_4: [0.0, 0.126] to [0.0, 0.0] Part 1 Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by 0.3464. 2. Extrude the sketch by 0.0315 towards the normal. Part 2 Instructions Part 2 Shape Construct a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism on top. The larger prism is centered on the smaller one. The smaller prism is positioned on the top face of the larger prism. The larger prism is centered on the white background. Part 2 Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system for Part 2 with the Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector of [0.0, 0.0315, 0.0177]. Part 2 Sketch Sketch_1: 1. Draw a rectangle on face_1 of the coordinate system with the following lines: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0265] to [0.0749, 0.0265] - line_2: [0.0749, 0.0265] to [0.0749, 0.0795] - line_3: [0.0749, 0.0795] to [0.0, 0.0795] - line_4: [0.0, 0.0795] to [0.0, 0.0265] Sketch_2: 1. Part 2 Dimensions The length, width, and height of Part 1 are 0.3464, 0.0315, and 0.3464, respectively. The length, width, and height of Part 2 are 0.75, 0.0315, and 0.75, respectively.</description>
